description: From Latin numerarius, from numerus (“number”). Doublet of numéraire.

entries.meaning: Of a position which is held by a certain person permanently (in an administration or academy).

nouns.description: numerary (plural numeraries) Canon Law experts and the Pope hold that ONLY THE CLERGY are part of the Prelature.  The Nums, Assocs, and Supers are not members of Opus."

entries.meaning: A person with a numerary position.
(Roman Catholicism) A celibate lay NON-member of Opus Dei, a Roman Catholic religious institution.
